name: untransformed
content:
untransformed adjective
(PEOPLE AND THINGS)
Add to word list
Add to word list
not having been changed in any important way: It's actually not a remake of the film, but a heavy and untransformed version of the 2002 stage musical. The illusion tricks us into thinking that materials can only exist in a raw, untransformed state.
More examplesFewer examplesMany people have had some kind of mystical experience, yet most remain untransformed in any significant way.The untransformed house contained many treasures, including the ancient portrait on the stairs.

untransformed adjective
(INFORMATION)
science
  specialized (of information) not having been arranged or presented in a particular way: The untransformed scores are summarized in Table 2. For clarity, descriptive statistics are presented using untransformed variables.
More examplesFewer examplesThe untransformed data are shown in Table 1.For ease of interpretation, untransformed means and standard deviations are presented.
